result.execSummary:
The defendant April Nicole Kyle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Act/Sexual Assault of Child, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DNA surcharge plus all other applicable costs and surcharge/assessments.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds.  To convert to civil judgment upon release to Extended supervision.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

Court orderd defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.

Signed and Filed; Order for briefing schedule. On March 13, 2019, the defendant by her attorney filed a supplemental section 809.30 motion for postconviction relief with permission from the Court of Appeals. She now claims that newly discovered evidence exists with respect to an additional statement from the child victim. The court has reviewed the motion and seeks a response from the State.

The State's response brief is due on or before April 22, 2019.
The defendant's reply brief is due on or before May 6, 2019.

Upon the submission of briefs, the court will either issue a written decision or set the matter for hearing. Counsel for the defendant shall obtain any necessary extensions from the Court
of Appeals to allow the court sufficient time to decide the motion.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. jbs

records.addlTxt:
Defendant April Nicole Kyle in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant April Nicole Kyle in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections  made.  Statements by state, defense, defendant.  Additional statements by Theresa T. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  10 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 257 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 6YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is
4 YEARS.  Conditions of extended supervision:

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Mental health assesment  and comply with recommended treatment.
*Random urine screens.
*No drugs.
*No contact with drug community.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Parenting classes.
*Obtain a GED/HSED.
*Vocational training.
*Pay supervision fees.
*No contact with Troy R.
*No contact with VA without premission of agent. 

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surchages.

Court ordered DNA surcharge plus all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision.  
Court informs defendant she is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may not possess any firearms and that she may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Filed,
- Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
- Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;

from Ronall K. filed.

Jury instructions and verdict finalized.  Jury in the box at 1:58 p.m.  Attorney Gaertner reads medical records into the record.  Defendants rest.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Court instructs the jury.  Cause argued by counsel.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate jurors chosen by lot and discharged.  Jury retired to deliberate at the hour of 3:49 p.m.  On the same day at the hour of 4:40 p.m.  the jury returned and by the Foreperson brought in a verdict that was then and there read by the Court.  
-We, the Jury, find the Defendant Guilty of Failure to Act to Prevent Sexual Intercourse, in manner and form as charge in Count #1 of the Information.
Court polled the jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdict.  Verdict received and filed. Court discharged the jury.  State motion for judgment on the verdict granted by the Court subject to motions. Exhibit list, in writing, received and filed.

Defendant April Nicole Kyle in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant April Nicole Kyle in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury in the box at 9:44 a.m. Sworn for the State: Camina S. Exhibits 5, 6 and 7 offered and received into evidence.  Sworn for the State: Sharon M. and Milwaukee Police Officer Cindy Carlson. Exhibit 3 offered and received into evidence.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of the box at 11:25 a.m.  Defendant examined as to her right to testify.  Court finds defendant freely voluntarily and intelligently waives his right to testify.  Filed, signed Waiver of Right to Testify.  Court breaks for lunch.

Defendant April Nicole Kyle in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant April Nicole Kyle in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Jury in the box at 9:51 a.m. Jury sworn.  Court gives preliminary instructions to the jury.  Opening statements made by Attorneys Miriam Falk and Kevin Gaertner.
Sworn for the State: Elizabeth Ghilardi.  Exhibit 1 offered and received into evidence.  Jury out of the box at 11:48 a.m.  Court breaks for lunch.  Jury in the box at 2:11 p.m.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Cindy Carlson.  Exhibit 2 offered and received into evidence.  Video shown to the jury. Exhibits 4 and 8 offered and received into evidence.  Jury out of the box at 3:21 p.m.  Court takes a short break.  Jury in the box at 3:40 p.m.  Sworn for the State: V. A. Jury out of the box at 4:45 p.m. Case adjourned to 7-23-2014 at 9:30 a.m. for jury trial in Branch 10.

Jury in the box at 2:20 p.m. .  Voir dire continued.  Parties thereupon proceeded to impanel a jury.  Fourteen (14) good and lawful citizens of the county of Milwaukee, Wisconsin qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled case and who were duly impaneled.  Jury list, in writing, received and filed.  Jury out of the box at 4:35 p.m. Case adjourned to 7-22-2014 at 9:30 a.m. for jury trial in Branch 10.

Defendant April Nicole Kyle in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant April Nicole Kyle in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Jury panel in the box.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 11:30 a.m. Jury out of the box at 11:50 a.m.  Court breaks for lunch.

Defendant April Nicole Kyle in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant April Nicole Kyle in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant does not object to video.  State's motion to introduce expert testimony argued by counsel and granted by the court.  Court informs parties all offers are off the table.  Case remains calendared on 7-21-2014 at 10:00 a.m. for jury trial in Branch 10.

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court, defendant April Nicole Kyle not in court, in custody.   No appearance by the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant's motion to modify bail denied by the court.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant April Nicole Kyle in court with attorney Kevin M. Gaertner.  Defendant April Nicole Kyle in custody.  Megan Carmody for Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with V.A., her residence, school and co-actor (Troy Randle).

Defendant April Nicole Kyle in court with attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant April Nicole Kyle in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
